qas.question: What year was Alsace-Lorraine occupied by Germany?
Approximately how many Alsace and Lorraine men were forced into the German army during World War II?
Which group of people were released by the Russians to Algiers?
When did Germany officially annex Alsace?
Baden and Saarland were merged to form what?
How many men from Alsace alone were conscripted into the German army?
130,000 men were involved in what massacre?
How many soldiers managed to join the resistance?

context: Alsace-Lorraine was occupied by Germany in <a0_0><b3_0>1940<b3_0/><a0_0/> during the Second World War. Although Germany never formally annexed Alsace-Lorraine, it was incorporated into the Greater German Reich, which had been restructured into <b4_0>Reichsgaue<b4_0/>. Alsace was merged with Baden, and Lorraine with the Saarland, to become part of a planned Westmark. During the war, <a1_0><b5_0>130,000<b5_0/><a1_0/> young men from Alsace and Lorraine were inducted into the German army against their will (malgré-nous) and in some cases, the Waffen SS. Some of the latter were involved in war crimes such as <b6_0>the Oradour-sur-Glane<b6_0/> massacre. Most of them perished on the eastern front. The few that could escape fled to Switzerland or joined the resistance. In July 1944, <b7_0>1500<b7_0/> <a2_0>malgré-nous<a2_0/> were released from Soviet captivity and sent to Algiers, where they joined the Free French Forces.
